revised_title: Theoretical Study of Positive Ion Passage through Gases
tldr: This article presents a theoretical study of the passage of positive ions through gases, focusing on the processes of elastic collisions, inelastic collisions, and neutralization through electron capture. The authors develop a theory applicable to ions and atoms with velocities lower than the orbital electrons of the atoms they collide with, providing a detailed analysis of the impact of two atoms and the cross-section for excitation of the state of the system by the impact.
